meanings.definition: Superlative form of squinny: to look with eyes partly closed, as in bright sunlight or because of strong emotion.
meanings.sent1: She squinniest at the bright sun to protect her eyes.
meanings.sent2: The child squinniest at the tiny ants crawling on the ground.
meanings.sent3: He squinniest at the menu, trying to decide what to order.
meanings.sent4: The detective squinniest at the suspect, trying to read his expression.
meanings.sent5: The old man squinniest at the photo, reminiscing about his youth.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of squinny: to look or peer with eyes partly closed.
meanings.sent1: The curious cat squinniest at the bird perched on the fence.
meanings.sent2: She squinniest at the distant mountains, admiring their beauty.
meanings.sent3: The toddler squinniest at the puzzle pieces, trying to figure out where they fit.
meanings.sent4: The artist squinniest at the canvas, envisioning the final masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The student squinniest at the textbook, struggling to stay awake.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of squinny: to look or peer with eyes partly closed, as in bright sunlight or because of strong emotion.
meanings.sent1: The hiker squinniest at the sunlit path ahead, shielding her eyes from the glare.
meanings.sent2: He squinniest at the emotional scene in the movie, tears welling up in his eyes.
meanings.sent3: The dog squinniest at the squirrel, eager to chase it up the tree.
meanings.sent4: The child squinniest at the birthday cake, excitement shining in his eyes.
meanings.sent5: She squinniest at the rainbow, marveling at its vibrant colors.
